managesubscription: Administre su suscripción a muchas categorías de alertas opcionales
marketplace_benefit_description1: Compara reseñas, calificaciones y precios de los servicios de Neighborly.
marketplace_benefit_description2: A veces, la ayuda que necesitamos está a la vuelta de la esquina, literalmente.
marketplace_benefit_description3: Chatea, paga, propina y revisa todo a través de una plataforma.
marketplace_benefit_description4: Elija y conéctese con el mejor vecino para el trabajo.
marketplace_desc1: Encuentre rápidamente ayuda calificada y local con las tareas periódicas de la casa, como el cuidado del césped, la limpieza, el cuidado de los niños y más.
master_services_agreement_text:
RESIDENT MASTER SERVICES AGREEMENT

THIS MASTER SERVICES AGREEMENT GOVERNS THE CUSTOMER PURCHASE AND RECEIPT OF THE RESIDENT PRODUCTS AND SERVICES.

BY ACCEPTING AN ONLINE QUOTE AND/OR PLACING A PURCHASE ORDER, THE CUSTOMER AGREES TO THE TERMS OF THIS MASTER SERVICES AGREEMENT. IF A DULY AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE OF THE CUSTOMER IS ENTERING INTO THIS MASTER SERVICES AGREEMENT ON BEHALF OF THE CUSTOMER, IT REPRESENTS THAT IT HAS THE AUTHORITY TO BIND THE CUSTOMER AND ITS AFFILIATES TO THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

The Customer may not use Resident Products & Services if it is a Resident direct competitor, except with Resident prior written consent. This Master Services Agreement is effective between the Customer and Resident as of the date of its acceptance by the Customer (the “Starting Date”).

 

Definitions

 

For purpose of this Master Services Agreement, the Parties hereby understand and agree that the following definitions shall govern:

    1. “Affiliate” means any legal entity that a Party owns, that owns a Party, or that is under common control with a Party.
    2. “Authorized Disclosure” means any and all disclosures of Confidential Information made in one or more of the circumstances set forth herein
    3. “Background Check” means a verification made in order to assess: 
  1. if an individual has been convicted of, placed in a pre-trial diversion program, or accepted responsibility (e.g., through a plea bargain) for, any crime, felony and/or misdemeanor involving fraud, theft, dishonesty, breach of trust or a violent act, by examining of the public criminal records data bases available for each jurisdiction where the individual resided during the seven (7) years prior to the verification.
  1. the identity, name, date of birth and signature of an individual by examining at least two pieces of valid identification evidencing such elements of identification, one of which having to be a government-issued photo ID; and
    1. “Background IP” means, with respect to a Party, IP in which or in respect of which that Party owns or is licensed all or part of Intellectual Property Rights prior to the Professional Services Starting Date or created independently from the General Consulting Services to be provided pursuant to this Professional Services Agreement.
    2. “BaseDrive Application” means Resident’s BaseDrive Application which can be either configured in Gamify Mode or UBI Mode.
    3. “BaseDrive Subscription” means the Subscription to the BaseDrive Application in the selected UBI Mode.
    4. “BaseDrive Subscription Fees” means either the Gamify Subscription Fees or the UBI Subscription Fees, depending on the selected UBI Mode.
    5. “BaseDrive Subscription Starting Date” refers to the BaseDrive Subscription Starting Date mentioned on the front page of this Subscription Form.
    6. “BaseDrive Subscription Term” means either the Initial Gamify Mode Term or the Initial UBI Mode Term, depending on the selected UBI Mode, as renewed from time to time.
    7. “Resident Agreements in Force and Effect” refers to any and all written agreements in force and effect entered into by and between the Customer and Resident, including this Master Services Agreement.
    8. “Resident” means Resident Telematics Inc.
    9. “Resident Applicable SLA” means, at any relevant time, the most recent version of Resident's service level agreement covering the Resident Online Services, and available on the Resident Website.
    10. “Resident Business Data” means any and all data related to, generated by, resulting from or created by the use of the Resident Services by anyone, including without limitation Performance Data as well as any and all other data obtained by, related to, generated by, resulting from or created by Resident’s own monitoring, maintenance and/or support of the performance and usage of the Resident Services, whether statistical, data mining related, secondary, operational, processed or otherwise, but to the exclusion of (i) the Customer Business Data, (ii) the Users Personal Data, and the (iii) Business Contact Data. 
    1. “Resident Contents” means any and all information, experience and knowledge, materially and/or digitally expressed or displayed through media such as texts, illustrations, embedded graphics, photos, video and audio, made, created, conceived, developed, invented or reduced to practice by Resident in order to be accessible by its customers through any of its Resident Services.
    2. “Resident Devices” refers strictly to devices approved by Resident allowing for (i) the tracking and collection of Customer Telematics Data and (ii) the transmission of such Customer Telematics Data to the Resident Solutions through the Resident Online Services and the Resident TestDrive Services, and via either (a) a Bluetooth connection to the External Users' own mobile devices or (b) a sim card embedded in such device. 
    3. “Resident Devices Procurement Agency Agreement” refers to any and all agreements and other instruments, if any, other than this Master Services Agreement and the Professional Services Agreement, entered into by and between the Parties, whereby Resident is appointed as agent of the Customer to help the Customer be supplied with Resident Devices.
    4. “Resident Solutions” means software, hardware and technologies (together with any and all released and available updates and upgrades) owned or licensed, and used by Resident to provide to its customers software solutions allowing for the creation and customization by its customer of usage based insurance program using telematics data in the field of property insurance, home insurance, car insurance, health insurance and life insurance, including without limitation the Resident UBI Solution. 
    1. “Resident Online Services” refers to any and all Resident Solutions and their respective supporting services, information and documents accessible by Resident customers online, to the exclusion of all General Consulting Services. 
    2. “Resident Public Cloud” means the Public Cloud Resident operates in order to provide the Resident TestDrive Services.
    3. “Resident Services” means any and all services provided by Resident or offered by Resident to be provided to the Customer, including without limitation the Resident Solutions, as well as any and all other software made available by Resident to the Customer on a software as a service (SaaS) basis.
    4. “Resident Workshop Services” refers to the Resident Workshop Services further detailed in the Resident Workshop Details document.
    5. “Best Efforts” means the efforts a prudent corporate entity desirous of achieving a result would use in similar circumstances to maximize, to the extent reasonably practicable, the probability that a result will occur and includes state of the art as it relates to any trade or profession, in addition to generally acknowledged best practices in a field of activity.
    6. “Beta Services” means Resident Services or functionality that may be made available to the Customer to try at its option at no additional charge and which is clearly designated as beta, pilot, limited release, developer preview, non-production, evaluation, or by a similar description.
    7. “Cloud Hosting Services” means computer infrastructure, network of virtual and physical web servers and related connectivity and processing services made available from time to time by third party providers to Resident and its customers for (i) the hosting of the Resident Solutions, the Resident Business Data, and the Customer Business Data, as well as their availability for Processing through an hybrid combination of Public Cloud and Private Cloud determined by Resident.
    8. “Command Center” means Resident’s Command Center
    9. “Company” means the company or other legal entity accepting the NDA, and all Affiliates of that company or entity.
    10. “Collated Data” means de-identified and aggregated data containing no information that would, in any way, allow identification any External User. Collated Data does not include any personal identifying number, symbol or other particular assigned to an individual, an individual’s name, an individual’s date of birth, an individual’s mailing address or street address, the GPS locations (latitude, longitude, altitude) collected, the VIN, or the unit ID. 
    11. “Confidential Information” confidential and/or proprietary information concerning the Disclosing Party and/or its business, products, customers, services, policyholders and/or claimants, including but not limited to information and/or documents concerning: (i) financial information, strategic business plans, policies and/or methods; (ii) marketing, claims, sales, underwriting strategy, and decision making processes; (iii) pricing and/or profit information; (iv) lists of actual or prospective customers; (v) proprietary and/or confidential intellectual property; and/or (vi) IP of third parties licensed to the Disclosing Party.
    12. “Customer” means the company or other legal entity accepting this Master Services Agreement, and all Affiliates of that company or entity.
    13. “Customer Algorithms” means any and all self-contained step-by-step set of calculation, data processing, and/or automated reasoning operations created, conceived, developed, invented or reduced to practice by the Customer and/or its Affiliates or sub-contractors, in order to produce Customer Rating Data through the use of Customer Telematics Data. Customer Algorithms shall be deemed to be Customer Business Data. 
    14. “Customer Business Data” means: (i) the Customer Algorithms; (ii) the Customer Rating Data; (ii) the Customer Telematics Data; and (iv) the Customer UBI Program Designs.
    15. “Customer Rating Data” refers to any and all data pertaining to External Users allocation of risks produced by the application of Customer Algorithms to Customer Telematics Data uploaded in the Resident Solutions through the Customer's use of the Resident Services. 
    16. “Customer Telematics Data” refers to any and all data pertaining to External Users' vehicles performance and event such as crashes, GPS positioning, hard acceleration & braking, cornering, distracted driving collected by the Customer through the External Users’ use of the Resident Services and uploaded in the Resident Solutions. 
    17. “Custom UBI Program” means the Customer's usage based insurance program using mobile telematics technologies and devices to be eventually created, configured and customized by the Customer for its specific needs, notably through the use of the Resident Online Services. 
    18. “Customer UBI Program Designs” means any and all UBI Program Designs created through the use of any Resident Solutions by (i) the Customer and/or by (ii) Resident Representatives through General Consulting Services expressly requested and provided to that effect. 
    19. “Deliverable” means a deliverable under an SOW, a Purchase Order or a Special Features Request. 
    1. “Delivery Logistic Agency Agreement” refers to any and all agreements and other instruments, if any, other than this Master Services Agreement and the Professional Services Agreement, entered into by and between the parties whereby Resident is appointed as agent of the Customer to help the Customer organize the logistic of the delivery the Resident Devices to its External Users.
    2. “Disclosing Party” means the Party who discloses, or whose Representatives disclose, Confidential Information. 
    3. “Documentation” refers to the User Guide and all other Resident publicly released publication describing the functionalities and specifications of the Resident Solutions.
    4. “DPW” or “Direct Premiums Written” means any and all premium paid, for any given month, by or on behalf of External Users, on insurance policies issued by the Customer, either before or during the Initial Gamify Mode Term or the Initial UBI Mode Term and their renewals, as applicable.
    5. “DPW Additional Fees” means the additional monthly Subscription Fees payable for the BaseDrive Subscription when the UBI Mode applies, which equal the sum of (i) the amount resulting from the application of the Standard DPW Rate on the DPW of External Users who were clients of the Customer prior to the BaseDrive Subscription Starting Date, and (ii) the amount resulting from the application of the New Clients DPW Rate on the DPW of External Users who became clients of the Customer on or after the BaseDrive Subscription Starting Date.
    6. “Effective Date” means the Effective Date set forth in the initial NDA between the parties.
    7. “External User” means an individual insured within the Territories by the Customer who have been granted authorization by Customer to use Resident Online Services pursuant and according to the Resident Online Services Agreement. 
    8. “Fees” refers to the applicable Online Services, TestDrive, Workshop, General Consulting Fees, as well as any and all other fees payable by Customer to Resident under any and all Resident Agreement in Force and Effect.
    9.  “Gamify Mode” means the configuration of the BaseDrive Application in Gamify Mode
    10. “Gamify Subscription Fees” refers to the monthly Gamify Subscription Fees mentioned on the front page of this Subscription Form.
    11. “General Consulting Fees” means any and all fees and costs that are to be charged by Resident to the Customer, for any and all General Consulting Services provided to the Customer by Resident pursuant and according to any Resident Agreement in Force and Effect. 
    12. “General Consulting Services” as the meaning ascribed to such expression in Section  3.1. (Scope of General Consulting Services) 
    13. “Governing Law” as the meaning ascribed to such expression in Section 20.1 (Governing Law).
    14. “Initial Gamify Mode Term” refers to the Gamify Term described on a Purchase Order which starts on the BaseDrive Subscription Starting Date.
    15. “Initial TestDrive Term” refers to the Initial TestDrive Term mentioned in a Purchase Order, which starts on the delivery of the TestDrive environment to the Customer. 
    16. “Initial UBI Mode Term” refers to the UBI Term mentioned on a Purchase Order, which starts on the BaseDrive Subscription Starting Date.
    17. “Intellectual Property Rights” shall mean intellectual property rights, including but not limited to patents, trademarks (whether or not registered), registered or unregistered design rights, copyrights (including, but not limited to, ownership rights in all titles, computer code, source code, themes, objects, sounds, audio-visual effects and methods of operation, moral rights and any related documentation), database rights, any and all rights in trade dress and packaging, trade secrets, any and all registrations and applications, renewals and extensions of, in and to the rights set forth above and all rights of an equivalent nature anywhere in the world. 
    18. “Internal User” means individual Representatives who has been granted authorization by Customer to use Resident Services pursuant and according to the terms and conditions of any Resident Agreements in Force and Effect. 
    19. “Initial Term” has the meaning ascribed to such term in Section 12.1 (Term).
    20. “IP” means anything that is or may be protected by Intellectual Property Rights, including without limitation works (such as algorithms, software, computer programs and applications), performances, discoveries, inventions, specifications, instructions, data, material, marks (such as trade names and service marks), trade secrets, designs, industrial designs, information, confidential information, and mask works. 
    21. “IP Modification” means any and all translation, abridgement, condensation, retrenchment, revision, correction, improvement, enhancement, integration, configuration, customization, expansion, addition, update, bug fix, patch, upgrade, new version or other modification of any pre-existing IP. 
 
    1. “Malicious Code” means code, files, scripts, agents or programs intended to do harm, including, for example, viruses, worms, time bombs and Trojan horses.
    2. “Manufacturers” means independent manufacturers, suppliers and/or similar other entity, preapproved by Resident, having the industrial capacity, know-how and expertise to produce and deliver on a sufficient scale and within reasonable delay the Resident Devices and other Products useful, necessary, and/or required by the Customer for proper use of the Subscribed Online Services by the Customer, its Affiliates, its Internal Users, and its External Users.
    3. “Minimal TestDrive Fees” refers to the Minimal TestDrive mentioned in a Purchase Order, payable by the Customer to Resident for the Initial TestDrive Term, and when the Customer elects to benefit from the Resident TestDrive and constituting the total subscription fees payable to Resident to access to the TestDrive Application according to the terms and conditions of the Resident TestDrive during the Initial TestDrive Term.
    4. “Minimal Workshop Fees” refers to the Minimal Workshop Fees mentioned on a Purchase Order payable by the Customer to Resident upon acceptance of Purchase Order and constituting the minimal consulting fees payable to Resident to benefit from the Resident Workshop Services up to the maximum of hours included.  
    5. “New Clients DPW Rate” refers to the New Clients DPW Rate mentioned on the front page of this Subscription Form.
    6. “Party, Parties” means individually Resident or Customer and collectively, Resident and Customer
    7. “PAS Software” means any software managing and/or processing data exchanged between the Customer and its External Users, including without limitation software known in the industry as “Client Relationship Management” software and "Policy Administration System" software, that may be developed by Customer or provided to Customer by third party providers and interacting with the Resident Services, including such software that may be included and installed in devices.
    8. “Performance Data” means information about service performance, Customer’s computers and Customer’s use of Resident Services, provided that such information excludes any Users Personal Data. 
    9. “Privacy and Data Protection Laws and Regulations” means any and all laws, regulations and guidelines, from any and all jurisdictions, applicable to the Processing, as well as more generally to the safeguarding of, Users Personal Data, by a Party, whether or not in connection with any and all Resident Agreements in Force and Effect. 
    10. “Private Cloud” means a cloud infrastructure: (i) offering virtualization and data center automation functionalities; (ii) operated behind a firewall through the Resident Solutions network solely for the use of the Resident Services by the Customer, the Internal Users and the External Users; (iii) managed internally by Resident; and (iv) hosted either internally on Resident servers or externally through a third party provider.
    11. “Processing”, “Process” means to access, collect, use, store, manipulate, transfer, disclose, analyze, or destroy any data, as well as any operation or set of operations which is performed upon Users Personal Data, whether or not by automatic means, such as collection, recording, organization, storage, adaptation or alteration, retrieval, consultation, use, disclosure by transmission, dissemination or otherwise making available, alignment or combination, blocking, erasure or destruction.
    12. “Procurement Fees” refers to the fees which are payable for the Procurement Services rendered in the Procurement Agreement.
    13. “Procurement Services” refers to the services described in the Procurement Agreement.
    14. “Products” refers to any other product agreed in writing upon by the Parties to be provided by any Manufacturers under the Procurement Agreement. 
    15. “Professional Services Agreement” refers to the Resident Master Professional Services Agreement entered into by and between the Parties before this Master Services Agreement.
    16. “Professional Services Starting Date” refers to the Professional Services Starting Date first herein mentioned on the front page of this Resident Professional Services Agreement. 
    17. “Public Cloud” means a cloud infrastructure: (i) offering virtualization and data center automation functionalities; (ii) accessible by the public over the Internet; (iii) managed externally by Resident; and (iv) hosted externally by a third party provider. 
    18. “Purchase Order” means an ordering document specifying the General Consulting or Online Services to be provided hereunder and that is entered into between Resident and the Customer, including any addenda and supplements thereto. Purchase Orders must state that it is governed by this Master Services Agreement. By entering into a Purchase Order, an Affiliate of any Party agrees to be bound by the terms of this Master Services Agreement as if it were an original party hereto. 
    19. “Receiving Party” means the party who receives, or whose Representatives receive, Confidential Information.
    20. “Representatives” means, in connection with Parties hereto, their directors, officers, employees, agents, advisors or other representatives and those of their affiliates (including, without limitation, their attorneys, accountants, individuals, bankers and financial advisors). 
    21. “Sensitive Data” means any and all (i) Resident Business Data; (ii) Customer Business Data; and (iii) Users Personal Data.
    22. “SOW” means any request made pursuant to and according to Section 3.1, other than Special Features Requests and Purchase Orders.
    23. “Special Feature” means a new set of procedures, functions, routines, subroutines, and/or subprograms made, created, conceived, developed, invented or reduced to practice by Resident and/or its Sub-Contractors in order to perform specific tasks not yet available through any Resident Solutions and to be packaged and offered by Resident to its customers as an independent set of features compatible with any one of said Resident Solutions. 
    24. “Special Features Request” and “Special Features Request Process”" refers to all the requests and the process.
    25. “Standard DPW Rate” refers to the Standard DPW Rate mentioned on the front page of this Subscription Form.
    26. “Starting Date” refers to the Starting Date of the Master Services Agreement, which is when it is duly electronically executed by the Customer.
    27. “Sub-Contractors” means any and all individuals, corporations, companies, cooperatives, partnerships, trusts, unincorporated associations, and other entities or body with juridical personality, including without limitation any Resident’s Affiliates, to which Resident delegates or otherwise sub-contract any General Consulting Services, Resident Workshop Services, and/or Resident TestDrive Services to be provided to the Customer pursuant to this Professional Services Agreement. 
    28. “Sub-Processors” means any and all individuals, corporations, companies, cooperatives, partnerships, trusts, unincorporated associations, and other entities or body with juridical personality, including without limitation any Resident’s Affiliates, to which Resident delegates or otherwise sub-contract any action relating to the Processing of any Users Personal Data, including independent Cloud Hosting Services providers. 
 
      1. “Standard Support Services” refers to the Standard Support Services described in the Resident Applicable SLA. 
      2. “Subscribed Contents” refers to the Resident Content subscribed by the Customer pursuant to Section 3.1 (Subscriptions). 
      3. “Subscribed Online Services” refers to the Resident Online Services subscribed by the Customer pursuant to Section 3.1 (Subscriptions).
      4. “Subscription” means a request by the Customer, duly accepted by Resident, to be granted the right to use one or more specific Resident Online Services. 
      5. “Subscription Fees” means the monthly fees the Customer is required to pay for its Subscriptions to the Subscribed Online Services and Subscribed Content. 
      6. “Subscription Term” means the duration of a Subscription, which shall be the total duration of the Initial Term plus any and all automatic renewals applicable pursuant to Section 12 (Term, Renewals, Expiry, and Termination)
      7.  “Termination Assistance SLA” refers to the Termination Assistance SLA described in the Resident Applicable SLA.
      8. “TestDrive Extension Fees” refers to the TestDrive Extension Fees mentioned on a Purchase Order and payable by the Customer to Resident for the extension of the Resident TestDrive over the Initial TestDrive Term.
      9. “Third-Party Products and Services” means any products, software, services, methodologies, tools, materials, architecture, design specifications, flowcharts, IP, Intellectual Property Rights, or other tangible or intangible items marketed by anyone other than Resident and/or its Affiliates.
      10. “UBI” means Usage Based Insurance.
      11. “UBI Mode” means the configuration of the BaseDrive Application in UBI Mode.
      12. “UBI Program Designs” means the look and feel resulting from some limited and specific design elements created to generate the specificity of the External Users interface of the mobile and web applications of the Customer's Custom UBI Program, being namely and exclusively the graphic aspects of the static elements of the External Users interface, such as its colors, shapes, layout, and typeface (the "look"), and the behavior of the dynamic elements of the External Users interface, such as buttons, boxes, and menus (the "feel").
      13. “UBI Subscription Fees” refers to the monthly UBI Subscription Fees
      14. “Users Personal Data” means any and all data or information, other than Collated Data, relating the External Users that, individually or in combination with other data, names or identifies a natural person or allows that such person be identified including: (i) data that is explicitly defined as a regulated category of personal data under applicable Governing Law; (ii) non-public personal data, such as national identification number, passport number, social insurance number (or equivalent number), or driver’s license number; (iii) health or medical information, such as insurance information, medical prognosis, diagnosis information or genetic information; (iv) financial information, such as a policy number, credit card number and/or bank account number; and/or (v) sensitive personal data, such as a person’s mother’s maiden name.
      15. “User Guide” refers to the then current online user reference guides.
      16. "Workshop Included Hours Package" refers to the Workshop Included Hours Package mentioned on a Purchase Order. 

 

Business relationship

 

For the purpose of any and all Resident Agreements in Force and Effect, each Party is an independent contractor and neither one shall be a legal representative, legal agent, partner, or franchisee of the other. No one of said Resident Agreements in Force and Effect creates any joint venture between the Parties, the relationship between the Parties being solely one of client and service provider.

 

TestDrive Application Services 

 

If the Customer has filed a Purchase Order for TestDrive (the trial version of the Resident Online Services) Resident will make one it available to the Customer on a trial basis according to such Purchase Order until the earlier of (a) the end of the TestDrive trial period set forth in the Purchase Order, or (b) the starting date of any Resident Online Service Subscribed pursuant to this Master Services Agreement. Additional trial terms and conditions may appear on the Purchase Order, which is incorporated into this Master Services Agreement by reference and is legally binding.

ANY DATA CUSTOMER ENTERS INTO THE RESIDENT ONLINE SERVICES, AND ANY CUSTOMIZATIONS MADE TO THE SERVICES BY OR FOR CUSTOMER, DURING THE TESTDRIVE TRIAL WILL BE PERMANENTLY LOST UNLESS CUSTOMER PURCHASES A SUBSCRIPTION TO THE SAME RESIDENT ONLINE SERVICES AS THOSE COVERED BY THE TESTDRIVE TRIAL, PURCHASE APPLICABLE UPGRADED SERVICES, OR EXPORT SUCH DATA, BEFORE THE END OF THE TESTDRIVE TRIAL PERIOD. IF CUSTOMER PURCHASES A SERVICE THAT WOULD BE A DOWNGRADE FROM THAT COVERED BY THE TESTDRIVE TRIAL, CUSTOMER MUST EXPORT ITS DATA BEFORE THE END OF THE TRIAL PERIOD OR CUSTOMER’S DATA WILL BE PERMANENTLY LOST.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary stated in any Resident Agreement in Force and Effect, the Resident Online Services provided during the TestDrive trial are provided “as-is” without any warranty.

 

BaseDrive Application Services

 

    1. Subscription to and Provision of BaseDrive Application Services

Resident shall provide access to the BaseDrive Application to the Customer, as Subscribed Online Services pursuant to this MSA, in the selected UBI Mode, and that the Customer shall pay either (i) the Gamify Subscription Fees or the (ii) UBI Subscription Fees plus the DPW Additional Fees, to Resident, depending on the selected UBI Mode, the whole according and pursuant to the terms and conditions of the Purchase Order, Subscription Form and this MSA. 

    1. Payment of BaseDrive Subscription Fees
 

The BaseDrive Subscription Fees are payable in advance, on a monthly basis and upon receipt of Resident’s invoices, the whole according and pursuant to the PSA and the OSA. The BaseDrive Subscription Fees are not refundable. 

    1. Payment of DPW Additional Fees
 

The DPW Additional Fees are payable on a monthly basis upon receipt of Resident’s invoices, the whole according and pursuant to the PSA and the OSA, and are not refundable. For the purpose of calculating the DPW Additional Fees, both Parties hereby agree that any and all data relating to the DPW payable by client of the Customer available to Resident through the BaseDrive Application, shall be deemed to be conclusive evidence of the DPW paid by such clients to the Customer.    

    1. Automatic Renewal
 

Upon expiry of the BaseDrive Subscription Term, or of any additional term in force and effect from time to time pursuant to this automatic renewal provisions, the BaseDrive Subscription shall thereafter continue to be in force and effect under the same terms and conditions for an additional term of six (6) months, unless an expiration notice stating that the Customer wishes this BaseDrive Subscription not to automatically renew has been sent by the Customer to Resident at least sixty (60) days prior to such expiry.

    1. Availability of BaseDrive Application
 

Resident will not guarantee, but hereby undertakes and agree to use commercially reasonable efforts, subject to any and all limitations, restrictions, and disclaimers stated in the Resident Applicable SLA, to make the BaseDrive Application available to the Customer, its Internal Users, and its External Users, twenty-four (24) hours a day, seven (7) days a week; provided however that such undertaking shall not apply to: 

  1. planned downtime (of which Resident shall give advance electronic notice as provided in the Resident Applicable SLA), and 
  2. any unavailability caused by circumstances beyond Resident’s reasonable control (including without limitation force majeure, Internet service provider failure or delay, and/or Third Party Products and Services failure or delay. 
    1. Summary of Application Services
 

BaseDrive Application. The BaseDriveTM Application is a turnkey mobile application designed to be highly customized and branded to the Customer’s requirements.  

The BaseDrive Application can be configured to be functional in one of two (2) modes: 

  • Gamify Mode: designed to create a user-base of new prospects for insurance products and;
  • UBI Mode, allowing to quote, sell and bind new policies from a mobile phone, leveraging Resident’s world renowned telematics based insurance underwriting and rating capabilities. 

Command Center. At the head of our solution is the Command Center, a fully featured back-end web portal designed to allow the Customer to view and report on its policies, list of users, pending quotes, claims statuses, as well as customize a variety of the BaseDrive Application’s features and settings. It also allows the Customer to view a variety of telematics data to allow adjustment of behavioral cohorts to improve scoring models for the of the Gamify Mode and the UBI Mode and their features.

 

Provision and Use of Services And Contents 

 

    1. Subscriptions

Customer’s rights to access and use any Resident Online Services and the Resident Contents are purchased by Customer as Subscriptions. The Customer may, but only through its Duly Authorized Representatives, place Subscriptions requests for Resident Services via any means made available by Resident for such Subscriptions requests, including via Subscription Forms. Affiliates and Internal Users may not place Subscriptions requests. Subscriptions may be added during the Subscription Term at the then current applicable Subscription Fees, prorated for the portion of that Subscription Term remaining at the time the Subscriptions are added, if applicable. Subscriptions provide rights of access to and use of the Subscribed Online Services and/or the Subscribed Contents for all Internal Users and External Users. The Customer agrees that none of its Subscriptions is contingent on the delivery of any future functionality or features, or dependent on any oral or written public comments made by Resident regarding future functionality or features.

    1. General Consulting Services

Customers must purchase a minimum amount of General Consulting Services when Subscribing to Resident Online Services.

    1. Right of Affiliates

The Customer may place Subscriptions for and on behalf of its Affiliates and grant such Affiliates administrative rights to access and use the Subscribed Online Services and the Subscribed Contents, provided however that such Affiliates shall then be bound solitarily (jointly and severally) by the terms and conditions of this Master Services Agreement.

    1. Provision of Subscribed Online Services

In consideration of the payment of the applicable Subscription Fees by the Customer to Resident, Resident will, but subject to any and all limitations, restrictions and disclaimers stated in the Resident SLA:

      1. make the Subscribed Online Services and the Subscribed Contents available to Customer, to its Internal Users, and to its External Users, according to this Master Services Agreement; 
      2. provide Standard Support Services to Customer for the Subscribed Online Services at no additional charges, as well as upgraded support services provided as General Consulting Services, if and when requested by Customer pursuant to the Professional Services Agreement.
    1. Liability for Affiliates, External Users, and Other Third Parties

The Customer hereby understands and agrees that it is and shall jointly and severally be liable for any and all activities of, and actions taken by, any of its Affiliates, Internal Users, External Users and other third parties to which it provides access rights under this Master Services Agreement and/or occurring under any of the Customer’s accounts and/or passwords.  

    1. Customer Resources and Use of Subscribed Online Services

Customer hereby acknowledges and represents to Resident that it possesses all necessary knowledge and skill particular to Customer’s industry and business practices and information which are involved in the proper use of the Subscribed Online Services. The Customer will provide Resident with access to Customer’s subject matter resources as part of Resident’s performance of the Subscribed Online Services.  Customer is solely responsible for Customer’s operation and use of the Subscribed Online Services (including without limitation the creation, configuration and customization of its Custom UBI Program) and for ensuring that the scope of the Subscribed Online Services meets Customer’s requirements. Any assistance by Resident with regard to such creation, configuration and/or customization of the Customer's Custom UBI Program shall be provided to Customer by Resident as General Consulting Services, if and when requested by Customer pursuant to the Professional Services Agreement.

    1. Authorized Users

      2. in consideration for the payment by the Customer of the General  Consulting Fees payable pursuant to the aforementioned Purchase Order, and the whole subject to the terms and conditions of said Professional Services Agreement, as well as any and all limitations, restrictions and disclaimers stated in the then-current Termination Assistance SLA, Resident shall perform General Consulting Services as reasonably requested by the Customer to assist the Customer in implementing and executing a Customer Data migration plan until the transition of the Customer Data to a new platform offering alternate telematics functionalities and services reasonably equivalent to those offered under the Subscribed Online Services has been successfully completed.

 

  • General Provisions

 

    1. Governing Law

Both Parties agree that the laws that will govern, interpret, and enforce the Parties’ respective rights, duties and obligations arising from, or relating in any manner to, the subject matter of this Master Services Agreement, without regard to conflict of law principles, shall be the laws determined by the Governing Law provisions of the province of Quebec or the federal courts of Canada situated therein, as applicable, sitting in the district of Laval.

    1. Jurisdiction

The sole and exclusive venue and jurisdiction over any action, claim, demand, proceeding or lawsuit whatsoever arising under or in relation to this Master Services Agreement shall be the courts determined by the Jurisdiction provisions the Governing Law. This choice of jurisdiction does not prevent either party from seeking injunctive relief with respect to a violation of Intellectual Property Rights or confidentiality obligations in any appropriate jurisdiction. The Parties waive all objections to this venue and agree not to dispute personal jurisdiction or venue in these courts.

    1. Export Compliance

Each Party represents that it is not named on any Canadian government denied-party list. Neither Party will access or use any Resident Online Services or Confidential Information provided to it hereunder in a Canadian embargoed country or in violation of any Canadian export law or governmental regulation.

    1. Anti-Corruption

The Customer declares not having received or been offered any illegal or improper bribe, kickback, payment, gift, or thing of value from any of Resident’s Representatives in connection with this Master Services Agreement. Reasonable gifts and entertainment provided in the ordinary course of business do not violate the above restriction. If the Customer learns of any violation of the above restriction, it will use reasonable efforts to promptly notify Resident.

    1. Order of Precedence

In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the provisions of this Master Services Agreement and any Subscription (as applicable), the provisions of such Subscription will prevail. In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the provisions of this Master Services Agreement and the Professional Services Agreement, the provisions of the Professional Services Agreement will prevail. 

    1. Severability

If a court holds any provision of this Master Services Agreement to be illegal, invalid or unenforceable, the other sections of said Master Services Agreement will remain in full force and effect and will not be affected by this decision. This Master Services Agreement will be amended to give effect to the eliminated provision to the maximum extent possible.

    1. English Language Controls

If there are any discrepancy between the English version of this Master Services Agreement and any version of another language, the English version takes precedence. If the Customer is in Canada, it is the express wish of both parties that this this Master Services Agreement, and any associated documentation, be written and signed in English. Il est de la volonté expresse des parties que ce Master Services Agreement, ainsi que les documents s’y rattachant soient rédigés en anglais.

    1. Legal Remedies

No failure or delay by a Party in exercising any right, power or privilege under this Resident Online Services shall operate as a waiver thereof, nor shall any single or partial exercise thereof preclude any other or further exercise thereof or the exercise of any right, power or privilege thereunder. Damages resulting from the breach of this Master Services Agreement may well be impossible to measure accurately, and injuries sustained by a Party may well be incalculable and irremediable. Therefore, in addition to claiming damages in respect thereof, each Party is entitled as a matter of right to seek an injunction to prevent a breach of the covenants and obligations thereof and such right shall be cumulative and in addition to any other remedies which may be available.

    1. Assignment and Affiliates 
  1. Subject to the foregoing, all Resident Agreements in Force and Effect will bind and inure to the benefit of the Parties, their respective successors and permitted assigns.
  2. Neither Party may assign any of its rights or obligations under any Resident Agreements in Force and Effect, whether by operation of law or otherwise, without the other Party’s prior written consent (not to be unreasonably withheld); provided, however, that either Party may assign all Resident Agreements in Force and Effect in their entirety, without the other party’s consent, to its Affiliate(s) or in connection with a merger, acquisition, corporate reorganization, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets, so long as such assignee entity shall expressly assume in writing the performance of the assignor's obligation under all Resident Agreements in Force and Effect, and have at least substantially similar resources to perform such obligations. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if a Party is acquired by, sells substantially all of its assets to, or undergoes a change of control in favor of, a direct competitor of the other Party, then such other Party may terminate this Agreement upon written notice.
    1. Entire Agreement 

This Master Services Agreement, and the relevant complimentary documents, Purchase Orders and Subscription Forms, constitute the entire agreement between the Parties concerning the provision of Resident Online Services by Resident to the Customer and its Affiliates, and supersedes any prior or contemporaneous communications, proposals or representations, written or oral, concerning its subject matter. No modification, amendment, or waiver of any provision of this Master Services Agreement will be effective unless in writing and signed by the party against whom the modification, amendment or waiver is to be asserted. 

    1. Notices

Except as otherwise specified in the Professional Services Agreement, all notices, authorizations, and requests in connection with any and all Resident Agreements in Force and Effect must be made in writing and sent by regular or overnight mail, or express courier, to the address of the other Party stated hereunder, or to such other address of such Party if it has previously been modified by duly delivered written notice. Notices of termination or of indemnifiable claims must clearly be identifiable as such by bearing the terms "Termination Notice" or "Indemnification Notice". Notwithstanding the foregoing, any and all notices to be given to the Customer by Resident may be sent via email at the email address provided by a Duly Authorized Representative of the Customer. 

Resident: Baseline Telematics Inc. 

324, Chemin du Tour, 

Laval (Quebec) H7Y 1S5 Canada
Contact for notices: Paul-André Savoie, ASC

President & CEO
Email address: pasavoie@baselinetelematics.com

Customer: As specified in the relevant Submission Form indicating the Customer’s acceptance of this Master Services Agreement.
master_services_agreement_text_1:
ACUERDO PRINCIPAL DE SERVICIOS

ESTE ACUERDO PRINCIPAL DE SERVICIOS RIGE LA COMPRA Y RECIBO DEL CLIENTE DE LOS PRODUCTOS Y SERVICIOS RESIDENTES.

AL ACEPTAR UNA COTIZACIÓN EN LÍNEA Y / O HACER UNA ORDEN DE COMPRA, EL CLIENTE ACEPTA LOS TÉRMINOS DE ESTE ACUERDO DE SERVICIOS PRINCIPALES. SI UN REPRESENTANTE DEL CLIENTE DEBIDAMENTE AUTORIZADO ESTÁ CUMPLIENDO ESTE ACUERDO DE SERVICIOS PRINCIPALES EN NOMBRE DEL CLIENTE, DECLARA QUE TIENE LA AUTORIDAD PARA OBLIGAR AL CLIENTE Y SUS AFILIADOS A ESTOS TÉRMINOS Y CONDICIONES.

El Cliente no puede utilizar Productos para residentes & Servicios si es un competidor directo Residente, excepto con el consentimiento previo por escrito del Residente.   Este Acuerdo marco de servicios entra en vigor entre el Cliente y el Residente a partir de la fecha de su aceptación por parte del Cliente (la “ Fecha de inicio ” ).

 

Definiciones

 

A los efectos de este Acuerdo marco de servicios, las Partes comprenden y aceptan las siguientes definiciones gobernará:

    1. “ Afiliado ” significa cualquier entidad legal que sea propiedad de una Parte, que sea propietaria de una Parte o que esté bajo control común con una Parte.
    2. “ Divulgación autorizada ” significa todas y cada una de las divulgaciones de información confidencial realizadas en una o más de las circunstancias establecidas en este documento
    3. “ Verificación de antecedentes ” significa una verificación realizada para evaluar:  
  1. si un individuo ha sido condenado, colocado en un programa de desvío previo al juicio o aceptado la responsabilidad (p. ej., a través de un acuerdo de culpabilidad) por cualquier delito, delito grave y / o delito menor que involucre fraude, robo, deshonestidad, abuso de confianza o un acto violento, mediante el examen de las bases de datos de antecedentes penales públicos disponibles para cada jurisdicción donde residió la persona durante los siete (7) años anteriores a la verificación.
  1. la identidad, el nombre, la fecha de nacimiento y la firma de una persona mediante el examen de al menos dos piezas de identificación válida que demuestren dichos elementos de identificación, una de las cuales debe ser un gobierno. identificación con fotografía emitida; y
    1. “ IP de fondo ” significa, con respecto a una Parte, PI en la cual o con respecto a la cual esa Parte posee o tiene licencia total o parcial de los Derechos de Propiedad Intelectual antes de la Fecha de Inicio de los Servicios Profesionales o creada independientemente de los Servicios Generales de Consultoría que se proporcionarán de conformidad con este Acuerdo de servicios profesionales.
    2. “ Aplicación BaseDrive ” significa Residente ’ s BaseDrive Aplicación que puede configurarse en modo Gamify o modo UBI.
    3. “ Suscripción a BaseDrive ” significa la suscripción a la aplicación BaseDrive en el modo UBI seleccionado.
    4. “ Tarifas de suscripción a BaseDrive ” significa las tarifas de suscripción de Gamify o las tarifas de suscripción de UBI, según el modo de UBI seleccionado.
    5. “ Fecha de inicio de la suscripción a BaseDrive ” se refiere a la fecha de inicio de la suscripción de BaseDrive mencionada en la página principal de este formulario de suscripción.
    6. “ Plazo de suscripción de BaseDrive ” significa el Período inicial del modo Gamify o el Período inicial del modo UBI, según el modo UBI seleccionado, según se renueve de vez en cuando.
    7. “ Acuerdos de residentes vigentes y en ” se refiere a todos y cada uno de los acuerdos escritos vigentes y en vigor celebrados por y entre el Cliente y el Residente, incluido este Acuerdo Maestro de Servicios.
    8. “ Residente ” significa Resident Telematics Inc.
    9. “ Residente Aplicable   SLA ”   significa, en cualquier momento relevante, la versión más reciente del acuerdo de nivel de servicio del Residente que cubre los Servicios en línea para Residentes y que está disponible en el Sitio web del Residente.
    10. “ Datos comerciales de residentes ” significa todos y cada uno de los datos relacionados con, generados por, resultantes de o creados por el uso de los Servicios para residentes por cualquier persona, incluidos, entre otros, los Datos de rendimiento, así como cualquier otro dato obtenido por, relacionado con, generado por, resultante de o creado por Resident ’ s propio monitoreo, mantenimiento y / o soporte del desempeño y uso de los Servicios para Residentes, ya sean estadísticos, relacionados con la minería de datos, secundarios, operativos, procesados o de otro tipo, pero con la exclusión de (i) los Datos Comerciales del Cliente, (ii) los Datos Personales de los Usuarios y (iii) los Datos de Contacto Comercial.  
    1. “ Residente   Contenido ”   significa toda la información, experiencia   y conocimiento, expresado o mostrado material y / o digitalmente a través de medios tales como textos, ilustraciones, gráficos incrustados, fotos, video y audio, realizado, creado, concebido, desarrollado, inventado o reducido a la práctica por el Residente con el fin de   ser accesible para sus clientes   a través de cualquiera de sus Servicios para residentes.
    2. “ Residente   Dispositivos ” se refiere estrictamente a los dispositivos aprobados por el Residente que permiten   para (i) el seguimiento y la recopilación de Datos telemáticos del cliente y (ii) la transmisión de dichos Datos telemáticos del cliente a las Soluciones para residentes a través de los Servicios en línea para residentes y   Servicios de TestDrive para residentes, y a través de (a) un   Conexión Bluetooth   al Externo   Los propios dispositivos móviles de los usuarios o (b)   una tarjeta SIM   incrustado   en tal dispositivo.  
    3. “ Residente   Acuerdo de agencia de adquisición de dispositivos ” se refiere a todos y cada uno de los acuerdos y otros instrumentos, si los hubiera,   que no sea este Contrato de servicios maestro y el Contrato de servicios profesionales, celebrados por y entre las Partes, mediante el cual el Residente es designado como agente del Cliente para ayudar al Cliente a recibir Dispositivos para residentes.
    4. “ Soluciones para residentes ” significa software, hardware y tecnologías (junto con todas y cada una de las actualizaciones y mejoras publicadas y disponibles) de propiedad o licencia, y utilizadas por Residente para proporcionar a sus clientes soluciones de software que permitan la creación y personalización por parte de su cliente de un programa de seguro basado en el uso utilizando telemática datos en el campo de seguros de propiedad, seguros de hogar, seguros de automóviles, seguros de salud y seguros de vida, incluida, entre otros, la Solución UBI para residentes.
master_services_agreement_text_2:
1. “ Servicios en línea para residentes ” se refiere a todas y cada una de las Soluciones para residentes y sus respectivas   servicios, información y documentos accesibles por   Clientes residentes   en línea, con exclusión de todos los Servicios de Consultoría General.  
    2. “ Nube pública residente ” significa el   Public Cloud Resident opera para proporcionar los servicios de TestDrive para residentes.
    3. “ Servicios para residentes ” significa todos y cada uno de los servicios proporcionados por el Residente u ofrecidos por el Residente que se proporcionarán al Cliente, incluidas, entre otras, las Soluciones para Residentes, así como cualquier otro software que el Residente ponga a disposición del Cliente en un software como servicio (SaaS) base.
    4. “ Servicios de taller para residentes ” se refiere a los Servicios de Taller para Residentes que se detallan más detalladamente en el documento Detalles del Taller para Residentes.
    5. “ Mejores esfuerzos ” Significa los esfuerzos que una entidad corporativa prudente deseosa de lograr un resultado utilizaría en circunstancias similares para maximizar, en la medida razonablemente posible, la probabilidad de que ocurra un resultado e incluye el estado de la técnica en lo que se refiere a cualquier oficio o profesión, además a las mejores prácticas generalmente reconocidas en un campo de actividad.
    6. “ Servicios Beta ” significa Servicios para residentes o funcionalidad que puede estar disponible para que el Cliente pruebe a su opción sin cargo adicional y que está claramente designada como beta, piloto, versión limitada, vista previa para desarrolladores, no producción, evaluación o por una descripción similar.
    7. “ Servicios de alojamiento en la nube ” hace referencia a la infraestructura informática, la red de servidores web virtuales y físicos y los servicios de procesamiento y conectividad relacionados puestos a disposición de vez en cuando por proveedores externos para el Residente y sus clientes para (i) el alojamiento de las Soluciones para residentes, los Datos comerciales del residente y los Datos comerciales del cliente, así como su disponibilidad para el procesamiento a través de una combinación híbrida de Nube pública y Nube privada determinada por el Residente.
    8. “ Centro de comando ” significa Residente ’ s Centro de comando
    9. “ Empresa ” significa la empresa u otra entidad legal que acepta el NDA y todas las afiliadas de esa empresa o entidad.
    10. “ Datos recopilados ” significa datos anonimizados y agregados que no contienen información que, de alguna manera, permitiría la identificación de cualquier Usuario Externo. Los datos recopilados no incluyen ningún número de identificación personal, símbolo u otro particular asignado a un individuo, un individuo ’ s nombre, un individuo ’ s fecha de nacimiento, un individuo ’ s dirección postal o dirección postal, las ubicaciones de GPS (latitud, longitud, altitud) recopiladas, el VIN o la identificación de la unidad.  
    11. “ Información confidencial ” información confidencial y / o patentada sobre la Parte Reveladora y / o su negocio, productos, clientes, servicios, asegurados y / o reclamantes, que incluyen, entre otros, información y / o documentos relacionados con: (i) información financiera, planes comerciales estratégicos, políticas y / o métodos; (ii) marketing, reclamaciones, ventas, estrategia de suscripción y procesos de toma de decisiones; (iii) información sobre precios y / o ganancias; (iv) listas de clientes reales o potenciales; (v) propiedad intelectual patentada y / o confidencial; y / o (vi) propiedad intelectual de terceros con licencia para la parte divulgadora.
    12. “ Cliente ” significa la empresa u otra entidad legal que acepta este Acuerdo de Servicios Maestro y todas las Afiliadas de esa empresa o entidad.
    13. “ Algoritmos del cliente ” significa cualquier conjunto autónomo paso a paso de cálculo, procesamiento de datos y / o operaciones de razonamiento automatizadas creadas, concebidas, desarrolladas, inventadas o reducidas a la práctica por el Cliente y / o sus Afiliadas o subcontratistas, en para producir datos de calificación de clientes mediante el uso de datos telemáticos de clientes. Los algoritmos del cliente se considerarán datos comerciales del cliente.  
    14. “ Datos comerciales del cliente ” significa: (i) los algoritmos del cliente; (ii) los Datos de Calificación del Cliente; (ii) los datos telemáticos del cliente; y (iv) el Cliente   Diseños de programas de RBU.
    15. “ Datos de calificación de clientes ” se refiere a todos y cada uno de los datos relacionados con la asignación de riesgos de los Usuarios externos producida por la aplicación de los algoritmos del cliente a los datos telemáticos del cliente cargados en las soluciones para residentes a través del uso de los servicios para residentes por parte del cliente.  
    16. “ Datos telemáticos del cliente ” se refiere a todos y cada uno de los datos relacionados con el rendimiento y el evento de los vehículos de los usuarios externos, como choques, posicionamiento GPS, aceleración & frenado, curvas, conducción distraída recopilada por el Cliente a través de los Usuarios Externos ’ uso de los Servicios para residentes y cargados en Soluciones para residentes.  
    17. “ Programa UBI personalizado ” significa el programa de seguro basado en el uso del Cliente que utiliza tecnologías y dispositivos de telemática móvil que el Cliente eventualmente creará, configurará y personalizará para sus necesidades específicas, en particular mediante el uso de los Servicios en línea para residentes.  
    18. “ Diseños de programas de RBU del cliente ” significa todos y cada uno de los Diseños del Programa UBI creados mediante el uso de Soluciones para residentes por (i) el Cliente y / o por (ii) Representantes residentes a través de Servicios de consultoría general solicitados y proporcionados expresamente a tal efecto.  
    19. “ Entrega ” significa un entregable en virtud de una SOW, una orden de compra o una solicitud de características especiales.  
    1. “ Acuerdo de agencia de logística de entrega ” se refiere a todos y cada uno de los acuerdos y otros instrumentos, si los hubiera,   además de este Contrato de Servicios Maestro y el Contrato de Servicios Profesionales, celebrados por y entre las partes, en virtud del cual el Residente es designado como agente del Cliente para ayudar al Cliente a organizar la logística de la entrega del   Dispositivos residentes a sus usuarios externos.
    2. “ Parte reveladora ” significa la Parte que divulga, o cuyos Representantes divulgan, Información confidencial.  
    3. “ Documentación ” refiere a la Guía del usuario y todas las demás publicaciones publicadas por residentes que describen las funcionalidades y especificaciones de las Soluciones para residentes.
    4. “ DPW ” o “ Primas directas escritas ” hace referencia a todas y cada una de las primas pagadas, para un mes determinado, por o en nombre de los Usuarios externos, en las pólizas de seguro emitidas por el Cliente, ya sea antes o durante el Período de vigencia del modo Gamify inicial o el Período del modo UBI inicial y sus renovaciones, según corresponda.
    5. “ Tarifas adicionales de DPW ” significa las Tarifas de suscripción mensuales adicionales pagaderas por la Suscripción BaseDrive cuando se aplica el Modo UBI, que equivalen a la suma de (i) la cantidad resultante de la aplicación del Tarifa estándar del DPW en el DPW de los usuarios externos que eran clientes del cliente antes de la fecha de inicio de la suscripción de BaseDrive, y (ii) el monto resultante de la aplicación de la tarifa DPW para nuevos clientes en el DPW de los usuarios externos que se convirtieron en clientes del Cliente en la fecha de inicio de la suscripción a BaseDrive o después.
    6. “ Fecha de vigencia ” significa la Fecha de entrada en vigencia establecida en el NDA inicial entre las partes.
    7. “ Usuario externo ” significa una persona asegurada dentro de los Territorios por el Cliente a quien el Cliente le ha otorgado autorización para usar los Servicios en línea para residentes de conformidad y de acuerdo con el Acuerdo de Servicios en línea para residentes.  
    8. “ Tarifas ” se refiere a   los Servicios en línea, TestDrive, Workshop, Tarifas generales de consultoría aplicables, así como cualquier otro   honorarios pagaderos por el Cliente al Residente en virtud de cualquier Acuerdo de Residente vigente y vigente.
    9.   “ Modo Gamify ” hace referencia a la configuración de la aplicación BaseDrive en modo Gamify
    10. “ Tarifas de suscripción a Gamify ” se refiere a las tarifas de suscripción mensuales de Gamify mencionadas en la portada de este formulario de suscripción.
    11. “ Tarifas generales de consultoría ” significa todas y cada una de las tarifas y costos que el Residente debe cobrar al Cliente,   para todos y cada uno de los Servicios de consultoría general proporcionados al Cliente por el Residente de conformidad con cualquier Acuerdo de Residente en Vigencia y Efecto.  
    12. “ Servicios generales de consultoría ” como se le atribuye a dicha expresión en la Sección   3.1. (Alcance de los servicios generales de consultoría)  
    13. “ Ley aplicable ” como se le atribuye a dicha expresión en la Sección 20.1 (Ley aplicable).
    14. “ Término inicial del modo Gamify ” se refiere al Término de Gamify descrito en una Orden de Compra que comienza en la Fecha de Inicio de la Suscripción de BaseDrive.
    15. “ Término inicial de TestDrive ” se refiere a   el   Término inicial de TestDrive mencionado en una orden de compra, que comienza con la entrega del entorno de TestDrive al cliente.  
    16. “ Término inicial del modo UBI ” refiere al Término UBI mencionado en una Orden de Compra, que comienza en la Fecha de Inicio de la Suscripción de BaseDrive.
    17. “ Derechos de propiedad intelectual ” significará derechos de propiedad intelectual, incluidos, entre otros, patentes, marcas comerciales (registradas o no), derechos de diseño registrados o no registrados, derechos de autor (incluidos, entre otros, derechos de propiedad en todos los títulos, código de computadora, código fuente, temas, objetos, sonidos, efectos audiovisuales y métodos de operación, derechos morales y cualquier documentación relacionada), derechos de base de datos, todos y cada uno de los derechos sobre imagen comercial y empaque, secretos comerciales, todos y cada uno de los registros y solicitudes, renovaciones y extensiones de, en ya los derechos enunciados anteriormente y todos los derechos de naturaleza equivalente en cualquier parte del mundo.  
    18. “ Usuario interno ” significa Representantes individuales a los que el Cliente ha otorgado autorización para utilizar los Servicios para residentes de conformidad con los términos y condiciones de cualquier Acuerdo para residentes en vigor y en vigor.  
    19. “ Término inicial ” tiene el significado que se le atribuye a dicho término en la Sección 12.1 (Término).
    20. “ IP ” significa cualquier cosa que esté o pueda estar protegida por derechos de propiedad intelectual, incluidos, entre otros, trabajos (como algoritmos, software, programas y aplicaciones informáticas), actuaciones, descubrimientos , invenciones, especificaciones, instrucciones, datos, material, marcas (como nombres comerciales y marcas de servicio), secretos comerciales, diseños, diseños industriales, información, información confidencial y obras de máscaras.  
    21. “ Modificación de IP ” significa cualquier traducción, resumen, condensación, reducción, revisión, corrección, mejora, mejora, integración, configuración, personalización, expansión, adición, actualización, error arreglar, parchear, actualizar, nueva versión u otra modificación de cualquier IP preexistente.  
 
    1. “ Código malicioso ” significa código, archivos, scripts, agentes o programas destinados a causar daño, incluidos, por ejemplo, virus, gusanos, bombas de tiempo y caballos de Troya.
    2. “ Fabricantes ” significa fabricantes independientes, proveedores y / u otra entidad similar, previamente aprobados por el Residente, que tienen la capacidad industrial, el conocimiento y la experiencia para producir y entregar en una escala suficiente y dentro de un plazo razonable los Dispositivos del Residente y otros Productos útiles, necesarios y / o requerido por el Cliente para el uso adecuado de los Servicios en línea suscritos por el Cliente, sus Afiliados, sus Usuarios internos y sus Usuarios externos.
    3. “ Tarifas mínimas de TestDrive ” refiere a   el TestDrive mínimo mencionado en una Orden de compra, pagadero por el Cliente al Residente por   el Período inicial de TestDrive, y cuando el Cliente elige beneficiarse del Resident TestDrive y constituye las tarifas de suscripción totales pagaderas al Residente para acceder a la Aplicación TestDrive de acuerdo con los términos y condiciones del Resident TestDrive durante el Período inicial de TestDrive.
    4. “ Tarifas mínimas del taller ” se refiere a   las tarifas mínimas del taller   mencionado en una orden de compra   pagaderos por el Cliente al Residente al aceptar la Orden de Compra y constituyen los honorarios mínimos de consultoría pagaderos al Residente para beneficiarse de los Servicios de Taller para Residentes hasta el máximo de horas incluidas.    
    5. “ Nuevos Clientes DPW Rate ” refiere a la tarifa de DPW para nuevos clientes mencionada en la portada de este formulario de suscripción.
    6. “ Fiesta, fiestas ” significa individualmente Residente o Cliente y colectivamente, Residente y Cliente
    7. “ Software PAS ” significa cualquier software que administre y / o procese datos intercambiados entre el Cliente y sus Usuarios externos, incluido, entre otros, el software conocido en la industria como “ Gestión de relaciones con el cliente ” software y software del "Sistema de administración de políticas", que puede ser desarrollado por el Cliente o proporcionado al Cliente por proveedores externos e interactuando con los Servicios para residentes, incluido el software que puede estar incluido e instalado en los dispositivos.
    8. “ Datos de rendimiento ” significa información sobre el rendimiento del servicio, Cliente ’ s computadoras y Cliente ’ s uso de los Servicios para residentes, siempre que dicha información excluya los Datos personales de los Usuarios.
